Package it.polimi.ingsw.client.view

Class Cli

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.client.view.Cli
All Implemented Interfaces:
Observer
public class Cli
extends java.lang.Object
implements Observer
Class Cli it's the main class which manages the game if the player decides to play with the command line interface.

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      Asks for the server ip address and port, then it creates a new Cli object and calls the setup() method on it.
      Parameters:
      args - the main args

    • isActive

      public boolean isActive()
      Returns the active attribute.
      Returns:
      the active attribute

    • setup

      private void setup()
      Sets up the connection with the server, asking if the player wants to join a new game or reconnect to a previous one. Tries to register the player with a provided nickname and start a thread that will contain the ClientConnectionSocket object used to send and receive messages from the server.

    • update

      public void update​(Message message)
      Acts based on the ViewMessage received, asking different things to player, printing updated view elements and sending different messages to the server.
      Specified by:
      update in interface Observer
      Parameters:
      message - the ViewMessage received

    • printGameBoardElem

      private GameBoardInfo printGameBoardElem​(java.lang.String owner)
      Used when printing an updated game board element. Prints the nickname of the owner of the element and returns the owner of the game board.
      Parameters:
      owner - the owner of the game board
      Returns:
      the game board of the specified player, null if no game board is found

    • showElements

      private void showElements​(int n)
      Prints some view elements based on the input provided by the player.
      Parameters:
      n - the number chosen by the player

    • askForGameBoard

      private void askForGameBoard()
      Asks the player whose game board he wants to see printed in the terminal and prints it. If the player is in a single player game it prints Lorenzo de Medici's position on the itinerary.

    • askForResource

      private Resource askForResource()
      Asks the player for a resource.
      Returns:
      the resource chosen by the player

    • askForLocation

      public java.util.List<ResourcePosition> askForLocation​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> stringList, boolean deposit, boolean canDiscard, boolean setupResources)
      Used when the player has to store resources or when he has to expend them. Returns the list of ResourcePosition objects needed to perform the action.
      Parameters:
      stringList - the list of strings which represents the resources that need to be stored or expended
      deposit - true if the resources are meant to be stored, false otherwise
      canDiscard - true if the player can discard the resources, false otherwise
      setupResources - true when selecting resources in the setup phase, false otherwise
      Returns:
      the list of ResourcePosition objects needed to perform the action

    • inWarehouse

      private java.lang.Integer inWarehouse​(java.lang.String res)
      Returns a integer which represents the warehouse shelf that contains a specified resource.
      Parameters:
      res - the resource
      Returns:
      the integer representing the warehouse shelf that contains the resource, null if no shelf contains that resource

    • printMarket

      private void printMarket()
      Prints the market disposition and the external marble.

    • printDevDecks

      private void printDevDecks()
      Prints the development decks.

    • printCardElement

      private void printCardElement​(java.lang.String s, boolean isDevCard)
      Prints an attribute of a card, used when printing cards in the terminal.
      Parameters:
      s - the attribute to print
      isDevCard - true if the card is a development card, false if the card is a leader card

    • buildResourceString

      public java.lang.String buildResourceString​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> list)
      Returns a string which represents a list of resources that can be either the input, output or the requirements of a card.
      Parameters:
      list - the list of resources
      Returns:
      the built string

    • printHandCards

      private void printHandCards()
      Prints the hand leader cards.

    • buildDevCardString

      private java.lang.String buildDevCardString​(java.util.List<DevCardInfo> list)
      Returns a string which represents a list of cards needed to play a leader card.
      Parameters:
      list - the list of development cards
      Returns:
      the built string

    • printGameBoard

      private void printGameBoard​(GameBoardInfo g)
      Prints all the game board elements of a player's game board.
      Parameters:
      g - the game board to print
